title: Alice Fulks
text:
Alice Claire Fulks (born January 16, 1982) is a voice and stage actress who got her start in voiceover work after she was introduced to <a href="ADV%20Films">ADV Films</a>' <a href="Automated%20dialogue%20replacement">ADR</a> director Steven Foster, who cast her as the Countess of Werdenberg in the 2003 <a href="anime">anime</a> series "<a href="Gilgamesh%20%28manga%29">Gilgamesh</a>". Following her spectacular performance as the Countess, Alice was later on cast as the lead role of Mylene Hoffman in <a href="009-1">009-1</a>, which was praised by <a href="Anime%20News%20Network">ANN</a> <a href="review">review</a>er Theron Martin. In 2007, she was one of the hosts of the <a href="American%20Anime%20Awards">American Anime Awards</a> presentation ceremony in <a href="New%20York%20Comic%20Con">New York Comic Con</a>.
Currently, Alice resides in <a href="Los%20Angeles%2C%20California">Los Angeles, California</a>, where she is the founder and creative director for video production company A*Light Picture.
